name: Great Voices From The Movies Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Orson Welles had a deep rich voice. Who was his co-star in 'Touch of Evil'?
questions.explanation:
Charlton Heston.

	He used the voice also to sell wine.

questions.text: Richard Burton also had a classic voice. Which of the following movies did NOT co-star him with Elizabeth Taylor?
questions.explanation:
'Night of the Iguana'.

	'Iguana' was a poor Tennessee Williams movie.

questions.text: Vincent Price, actor-gourmet-artist, was best known for horror movies. Which of the following is NOT one of his?
questions.explanation:
'The Invisible Man'.

	That was done by another fine actor, Claude Rains.

questions.text: James Earl Jones has a big, booming voice. He starred in 'Great White Hope'. He played a boxer based on which of the following?
Sean Connery has a distinctive style. Who was his co-star in 'Robin and Marian'?
questions.explanation:
Audrey Hepburn.

	Bracco was 'Medicine Man'. Jones was 'Entrapment'. Eaton was 'Goldfinger'.

questions.text: Cary Grant may not have had a magnificent voice - but he had an unusual way of delivering his lines. Which of the following is one of his movies?
questions.explanation:
'Father Goose'.

	The others are John Wayne ('Alley'), Robert Taylor ('Bridge') and Gary Cooper ('Doe').

questions.text: James Stewart also had a rare style of delivering his lines. He starred in 'The Stratton Story'. Who was Stratton?
questions.explanation:
Ballplayer.

	Monty Stratton, a baseball player who became injured.

questions.text: Andy Devine had a squeaky, irritating voice - but there was never any doubt about who was speaking. In which of these John Wayne movies did he appear?
James Cagney has been imitated as often as anyone. In which of the following movies does he NOT die at the end?
questions.explanation:
'Yankee Doodle Dandy'.

	'13' and 'Heat' have great endings.

questions.text: Walter Brennan had a thick, easy-to-recognize voice. In 'My Darling Clementine' he confronted which of the following legendary figures?
questions.explanation:
Wyatt Earp.

	He played Ike Clanton.
